title: Buying Wheat, Salt, Barley Dates on credit or does it have to be simultaneous (Riba) Assim al hakeem
transcript: I know that if I want to exchange gold with money that need to be simultaneous but if I want to exchange money with the salt value with or dates are they need to be simultaneous or I can buy them on credit okay so the question is in regards to the six items of Goods that the prophet mentioned in terms of categories of riba which are gold silver wheat barley dates and salt so the prophet Islam when he mentioned these he said if these categories differ you can sell and buy regardless but if the same category you have to have equality gold with gold you have to have equality and it has to be simultaneous gold and silver you can't have equality because there are different categories but it has to be simultaneous gold and silver is one category which depends on the value or what is known as femini while barley wheat dates and salt they are another category which is considered to be related to what to be used as food and weighed so these two categories if they are interchangeable or exchangeable I want to buy with my gold a kilogram of wheat or 10 kilograms of dates can I do this yes you can can I do it and not have it simultaneous meaning I buy it in installments yes you can without any problem but the categories among themselves gold and silver and whatever currency Falls underneath them because it carries the same ruling and food items that are weighed and can be stored like these other four in between it has to be simultaneous otherwise you can sell and buy without any problem and Allah knows best yes
